result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:09 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Paul Zilles present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zilles - defendant will be sentenced in Fond du lac County on June 2, 2016 and these cases will be dismissed and read-in over there.  Court sets for internal review on 06/05/2016.

Court adjourned at 9:10 a.m.
Status hearing on May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

11:16 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Paul Zilles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  2016ct13-Atty Zilles has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Atty Zilles now confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Zilles enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.    Court will set for Status Hearing on May 16, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.

2016CF7 - Statement by Atty Zilles - Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Zilles and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Zilles enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 16, 2016 at 9:00 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:22 a.m.
Fond du lac County Jail - 04/12/2016 at 10:30 a.m. (Status of prelim)
Status hearing on April 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

1:43 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Paul Zilles present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zilles.  Court sets for Status of Prelim on April 12, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:44 p.m.

8:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on February 23, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:59 a.m.
